question_text: The police caught the bank robber. → The bank robber ___ by the police.
Many students visit the museum. → The museum ___ by many students.
The laundry is done by my mom. → My mom ___ the laundry.
This house was built a long time ago. → They ___ this house a long time ago.
My teacher wrote this book. → This book ___ by my teacher.
They have reached their goal. → The goal ___ reached.
These articles were written by famous writers. → Famous writers ___ these articles.
Rita wrote the letter to him. → The letter ___ to him by Rita.
You will be given some instruction by the manager. → The manager ___ you some instruction.
She told me a lie. → A lie ___ by her.
Ted is the boy ___ is reading on the bench.
type: relative pronouns and mixed verb patterns

question_text: There is the man ___ car was stolen.

question_text: You may lose friends ___ you don’t treat them nicely.
We ___ late unless we hurry.
Take your umbrella in case it ___.
He acted ___ he didn’t do anything wrong.
You will be sick unless you ___ eating.
She loses her job, she would still have enough money.
Once I’m done with chores, I ___ the dog.
If only I had taken the train, I ___ late.
You’d better write them down; ___ you won’t remember them.
You will fail ___ you study harder.
If Sujin had been at the mall, she would have be lost.
If you take precautions, you should have any problems.
If you will knock on wood, you will keep bad luck away.
If she doesn’t study, she wasn’t going to pass the test.
If I was president, I would have so much power.
If I will get money tomorrow, I will go on a vacation.
If I invited everyone for dinner, there won’t be enough space.
What will have happened if I had never met my wife?
If Joe had worked harder, she can have gotten a promotion.
If she went there by car, she won’t arrive on time.
The monster looks as if it were real. In fact, it ___ real.
Mom suggested that I go abroad. Mom believed I ___ go abroad.
If I had stayed at the beach, I could have seen the sunset. As I didn’t stay, I ___ see it.
He makes it seem as if he ___ the song. In fact, he didn’t.
If I ___ you, I would say sorry first.
I ___ I was so rich. I am not rich now.
If I were you, I ___ ask for more. (Don’t ask for more.)
If it ___ so cold, I would go hiking. (It is very cold.)
Everything could have turned out differently if you ___ me earlier.
If I had been there, I would ___ hurt badly.
